name: Altered State Machine

score_rationale.persistence: Operating since 2022. Survived bear market. Active development continues but market activity has decreased from peak.
score_rationale.autonomy: Provides infrastructure for autonomous AI agents, but the platform itself is not autonomous. Individual agents on the platform have varying autonomy levels. 'Tool' tier for the protocol itself.
score_rationale.cultural_impact: Significant in crypto/gaming intersection. Patent pending for AI ownership via NFTs. Less mainstream recognition than pure art-focused agents.
score_rationale.economic_reality: ASTO token actively traded. NFT sales for brains and forms. Protocol generates economic activity through agent training and competition.
score_rationale.governance: Token-based governance through ASTO. Community participation in ecosystem decisions. Founding team retains significant influence.
score_rationale.tech_distinctiveness: Novel Brain/Memory/Form NFT architecture. Patent-pending approach to AI agent ownership. Integration of ML training with NFT ownership. Genuine innovation in agent composability.
score_rationale.narrative_coherence: Clear 'Non-Fungible Intelligence' positioning. Metaverse avatar focus. Some identity confusion between infrastructure protocol and individual agents.

curator_notes: Altered State Machine represents a unique approach to agent infrastructureâ€”treating AI agents as composable NFTs with Brain, Memory, and Form components. Co-founded by Aaron McDonald (EY Entrepreneur of the Year) and team, ASM has a patent pending for AI ownership via NFTs. While primarily infrastructure rather than a single autonomous agent, ASM's AIFA (AI Football Association) demonstrates autonomous agent-vs-agent competition. The protocol enables a new category of games where NFT AI bots play autonomously.

evidence.claim: Patent pending for AI ML model ownership via NFTs
ASTO token actively traded with defined utility
